turns.utterance: Okay, I'm still really stuck on this physics problem. It says a 2kg ball is dropped from a height of 10 meters. Calculate the potential and kinetic energy at 5 meters. I just don't even know where to start!

turns.speaker: agent

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Good job on the potential energy! Now, remember the law of conservation of energy: the total energy (PE + KE) remains constant. At the start, all the energy is potential. As the ball falls, potential energy is converted into kinetic energy. Therefore, at any point, PE + KE = initial PE. So, KE at 5 meters = Initial PE - PE at 5 meters = 196 Joules - 98 Joules = 98 Joules. Does that make sense?
